alert.note: Alert for San Diego (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 22 at 11:24AM PST until January 22 at 12:45PM PST by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 1230 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON FOR EASTERN VALLEYS IN SAN DIEGO COUNTY AND THE COASTAL SLOPES OF THE SAN DIEGO COUNTY MOUNTAINS... * WHAT...Flooding caused by moderate to locally heavy rainfall will continue. * WHERE...Eastern valleys of San Diego County to the coastal slopes of the San Diego County mountains. * WHEN...Until 1230 PM PST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Areas of mud, debris, and rocks possible on mountain roads. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1122 AM PST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing and could continue into the afternoon. Between 0.75 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen in the past 6 hours. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 0.75 inches are expected over the area though this afternoon. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Ramona, Alpine, Julian, Cuyamaca Rancho State Park, Mount Laguna, Valley Center, I-8 Between Pine Valley And Boulevard, Fallbrook, Escondido and Hwy 78 Between Ramona And Santa Ysabel. - https://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
